intro: Aeschynomene priscoana, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Aeschynomene priscoana is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it useful in agricultural settings.
